placeDesc: Tatami-ishi 畳石 (Tatami-Rocks) is a Nationally Designated Natural Monument located on the south coast of Oujima 奥武島 (Ou Island).These pentagonal and hexagonal shaped rocks, formed by andesite magma cooled under a geological process called columnar jointing, are called Tatami-Rocks because of the resemblance to the tatami mats of traditional Japanese home design.Water erosion has leveled and smoothed the tops of the rock structures.
placeShortDesc: Unusual hexagonal rocks formed by cooling lava named for their resemblance to traditional Japanese tatami mats.
